title: Neurological Disease Performance Gap Analysis

findings.root_cause: EMBEDDING ISOLATION + LOW GT DRUG COVERAGE

alzheimers.note: kNN has NO chance of finding correct drugs

drug_class_analysis.note: Unlike statins, neurological drugs have cross-category usage (psychiatric, pain)

reasons: Neurological-specific drugs have low training frequency (freq=1-4)
No single dominant drug class like statins for metabolic

possible_mitigations: Explicit neurological drug catalog injection at inference
Accept lower precision for neurological category
External data: Gene expression profiles for neurological diseases

conclusion:
h168 VALIDATED: Neurological low precision (26.1%) is due to FUNDAMENTAL kNN limitations.
    
Neurological diseases cluster with 'other' category in embedding space (92% of neighbors).
This means kNN recommendations come from non-neurological diseases which don't have neurological drugs.
Drug class rescue (like h144 statins) is not feasible because neurological drugs have:
- Low training frequency (most freq=1-4)
- Cross-category usage (anticonvulsants for psychiatric, pain)

This is NOT a model bug but a DATA STRUCTURE issue. The only solutions require either:
1. Modifying the kNN algorithm (category-weighted similarity)
2. External data injection (explicit neurological drug catalogs)
3. Accepting lower precision for this category
